member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolDownloadStrategy.First
member.summary: Download the first version that comes back and cancel the other requests.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolDownloadStrategy.Latest
member.summary: Download the latest version. Requests that fail are ignored but at least one request must succeed.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolDownloadStrategy.All
member.summary: All requests to find a tool version must succeed. This is really only useful for testing.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolRunnerType
member.summary: The types of tools runner.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolRunnerType.VirtualDesktop
member.summary: A tool runner that uses the Windows API to create a virtual desktop and process jobs to start a tool and keep it hidden. The associated implementation of is .

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolRunnerType.Simple
member.summary: A tool runner that uses basic processes to start and stop jobs. The associated implementation of is .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.DownloadableFile.Version
member.summary: The version of the tool to download.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.DownloadableFile.Url
member.summary: The absolute URL of the tool download.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.DownloadableFile.Format
member.summary: The format of the downloadable file.

member.summary: An interface for building tool configuration.

member.summary: Configure a tool given the provided settings.
member.param: The tool that is being configured.
member.returns: The configuration key and values to be written to a file.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool
member.summary: An extracted instance of a tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.Settings
member.summary: The generic settings of the tool, agnostic of this specific extracted instance.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.ZipPath
member.summary: The path to the compressed archive that was used to initialize the tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.Version
member.summary: The version of the tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.DirectoryPath
member.summary: The base extracted directory of the tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.ExecutablePath
member.summary: The full path to the tool's main executable.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: The full path to the tool's working directory.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.Tool.ConfigurationPath
member.summary: The full path to the tool's configuration file.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings
member.summary: Information on how a tool is laid out on disk and how it should be interacted with by TorSharp.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.Name
member.summary: The name of the tool for messages.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.Prefix
member.summary: The prefix of the compressed tool's file name. For example, "tor-linux32-".

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.ExecutablePath
member.summary: The relative path inside the extracted directory to the tool's main exectuable.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: The relative path inside the extracted directory to use as the tool's working directory.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.ConfigurationPath
member.summary: The relative path inside the extracted directory to the tool's configuration file.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.GetArguments
member.summary: The delegate to get the arguments for a tool, given a tool instance.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.GetEnvironmentVariables
member.summary: The delegate to get the additional environment variables for a tool, given a tool instance.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.ZippedToolFormat
member.summary: The format of the compress tool archive file.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.GetEntryPath
member.summary: A delegate to determine whether an entry (file) in the tool archive should be extracted. The input string is the entry name inside the archive. The returned string is the relative path inside the extracted directory to use for the entry. If null is returned, the entry is skipped.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ToolSettings.ExecutablePathOverride
member.summary: A verbatim path used to point to the tool executable. This can be an absolute path, a path relative, or an executable name present in the PATH variable (e.g. installed to the local machine).

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ZippedToolFormat
member.summary: The format of a zipped tool, i.e. how it is compressed.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ZippedToolFormat.Zip
member.summary: A ZIP file.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ZippedToolFormat.Deb
member.summary: A Debian package.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.Tools.ZippedToolFormat.TarXz
member.summary: A tarball file compressed using the XZ compression format.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdate.HasUpdate
member.summary: Whether or not there is an update available for this tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdate.LocalVersion
member.summary: The latest local version. Null if no local version exists as indicated by with a value of .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdate.DestinationPath
member.summary: The path that would be downloaded to by .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdate.LatestDownload
member.summary: Information about the latest downloadable tool.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdates
member.summary: Update information for the tools needed to run .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdates.HasUpdate
member.summary: Whether or not there is an update available for one or more tools.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdates.Privoxy
member.summary: Update information for Privoxy.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdates.Tor
member.summary: Update information for Tor.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdateStatus
member.summary: The status of the tool update.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdateStatus.NoUpdateAvailable
member.summary: No update is available meaning the latest local tool is the same version as the version available remotely.

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdateStatus.NoLocalVersion
member.summary: There is no version available locally. In this case, will fail to run if no tool is downloaded and put into the .

member.name: F:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdateStatus.NewerVersionAvailable
member.summary: A version is available locally but a newer version is available remotely. In this case, will run using this existing local version if no newer version is downloaded.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUtility
member.summary: A support utility for reading the directory containing the tools.

members.member:
Read the and find the latest tool matching the criteria in the provided . If none is found return null.
/// The settings for TorSharp. The settings for the tool. The tool, or null if none was found.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpArchitecture
member.summary: CPU architectures that TorSharp can run on.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpOSPlatform
member.summary: Operating systems that TorSharp can run on.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpPrivoxySettings.Port
member.summary: The port that Privoxy listens to. This is the port of the HTTP proxy. This defaults to 18118.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpPrivoxySettings.ListenAddress
member.summary: The address that Privoxy listens to. This defaults to 127.0.0.1.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpPrivoxySettings.ExecutablePathOverride
member.summary: Override that path to the Privoxy executable. The simplest usage is to ensure "privoxy" is in the PATH environment variable and setting this property to "privoxy". This setting is intended for providing an executable already installed to the host machine rather than the one extracted from the tools archive. Note that this does not disable the tool fetching or extraction process since the base configuration and other peripheral files still are extractied from the . This is helpful when the tool fetched via the is not compatible with the host machine.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy
member.summary: The main proxy controller implementation. This class handles extracting the tools (Privoxy and Tor), configuring them, starting them, and stopping them.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy.#ctor(Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the proxy controller.
member.param: The settings to dictate the proxy's behavior.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy.ConfigureAndStartAsync
member.summary: Configure the tools and start them.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy.GetNewIdentityAsync
member.summary: Tell Tor to clean the circuit and get a new identity.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy.GetControlClientAsync
member.summary: Returns a connected and authenticated a Tor control client for the running Tor process. The caller is responsible for disposing of the returned control client.
member.returns: The Tor control client that is already connected and authenticated.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpProxy.Stop
member.summary: Stop the tools so that the proxy is no longer listening on the configured port.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings
member.summary: Settings for how TorSharp behaves.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.ReloadTools
member.summary: If true, the tools (Tor and Privoxy) will be re-downloaded by even if the latest version is already downloaded and will be re-extracted by even if the latest version is already extracted. This is disabled by default.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.EnableSecurityProtocolsForFetcher
member.summary: Enable all SSL/TLS protocol on so that requests to fetch the tools don't fail due to protocol mismatches. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.ToolRunnerType
member.summary: The way in which tools should be run. The default is on Windows so that the Privoxy and Tor windows are not visible and for other operating systems.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.ZippedToolsDirectory
member.summary: The directory to download the zipped tools. This defaults to %TEMP%\Knapcode.TorSharp\ZippedTools.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.ExtractedToolsDirectory
member.summary: The directory to extract the tools to and run them from. This defaults to %TEMP%\Knapcode.TorSharp\ExtractedTools.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.UseExistingTools
member.summary: Instead of downloading the latest version of the tools in , use any existing tools already downloaded to .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.ToolDownloadStrategy
member.summary: What strategy to use when fetching the latest version of a tool. This behavior matters when there are multiple URLs or feeds that a checked for a single tool.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.OSPlatform
member.summary: The operating system that TorSharp should assume it is running on. This defaults to on .NET Framework and is automatically detected on .NET Core.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.Architecture
member.summary: The CPU architecture that TorSharp should assume it is runnong on. This is automatically detected using the architecture of the process.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.WaitForConnect
member.summary: How long to wait for each tool to accept connections while starting up. This allows for the tools to start up before completing the initialization process. Defaults to 5 seconds. This can be completely disabled by setting this property to .

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.PrivoxySettings
member.summary: Settings specific to Privoxy.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpSettings.TorSettings
member.summary: Settings specific to Tor.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpToolFetcher
member.summary: Fetch the latest version of the tools from the internet.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpToolFetcher.CheckForUpdatesAsync
member.summary: Checks for updates of the tools and returns what is found. Inspect the property to determine whether updates are available. This is determined by checking the the latest versions are already downloads to the .
member.returns: Information about whether there are tool updates.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpToolFetcher.FetchAsync(Knapcode.TorSharp.ToolUpdates)
member.summary: Downloads the latest version of the tools to the configured given the tool updates already discoved. This should be called after getting the result of .

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpToolFetcher.FetchAsync
member.summary: Downloads the latest version of the tools to the configured . This method always tries to download the latest version of the tools unless is set to true.

member.name: T:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings
member.summary: Settings specific to Tor.

member.name: M:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the TorSharp settings with default ports set.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.SocksPort
member.summary: The port that Tor listens to for SOCKS. This is the port that Privoxy tunnels to. This defaults to 19050. See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#SocksPort for details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.ControlPort
member.summary: The port that Tor listens to for control and administrative commands. This defaults to 19051. See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#ControlPort for details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.ExitNodes
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#ExitNodes for details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.StrictNodes
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#StrictNodes for details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.ControlPassword
member.summary: The unhashed version of . TorSharp will hash it on your behalf if set and is not set.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.HashedControlPassword
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#HashedControlPassword for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.DataDirectory
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#DataDirectory for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.HttpsProxyHost
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#HTTPSProxy for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.HttpsProxyPort
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#HTTPSProxy for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.HttpsProxyUsername
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#HTTPSProxyAuthenticator for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.HttpsProxyPassword
member.summary: See https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en#HTTPSProxyAuthenticator for more details.

member.name: P:Knapcode.TorSharp.TorSharpTorSettings.ExecutablePathOverride
member.summary: Override that path to the Tor executable. The simplest usage is to ensure "tor" is in the PATH environment variable and setting this property to "tor". This setting is intended for providing an executable already installed to the host machine rather than the one extracted from the tools archive. Note that this does not disable the tool fetching or extraction process since the base configuration and other peripheral files still are extractied from the . This is helpful when the tool fetched via the is not compatible with the host machine.
